inn1.comm: back of a length, outside off stump, not much movement and Amla stays in the crease, pats back to the bowler
length ball angling in towards off stump, solid forward defensive
slings this down the leg side, length delivery and slapped through backward square leg with a flick of the wrists, Steven Finn doing his Bambi impression on the boundary to prevent four
good length ball outside off, swinging away a touch and left alone
pitched up around middle and off, just holding its line and Amla punches a drive back at Anderson, who stopsthe ball  with his boot
shoots through a touch low, delivered on a length outside off, blocked on the back foot
length delivery, touch down the leg side and chopped through square leg with relish by Smith, to get him off the mark
angled across outside off, Smith gets outside the line of off stump and pushes back to the bowler
length ball, pushed across the left-hander again, punched back down the track and Finn gets a hand on it
pitched up around the line of off, Smith closes the face and squirts it through square leg for another couple
shorter length, tries to pull the ball late and is hit on the body
beaten outside the off, though Smith drew his bat away ... and again Finn flicks off the bails, to Smith's evident displeasure, though Dharmasena is apparently happy to live with it
back of a length, outside off and coming back in, Amla miscues a hook shot into the off side
back of a length, leaving Amla and he swishes at it unsuccessfully
good length ball outside off, left alone outside off this time
pitched up outside off stump and punched to extra-cover
full and outside the line, leans forward and drills a drive fine, past mid-off and away for the first boundary of the innings
on the stumps, gets across and flicks through square leg
too straight to Smith, who again closes the face and clips a four through midwicket
pushed back wide of the mid-on for a single
back of a length, good angle in towards off stump, Amla tries to flick through the leg side and misses, hit on the pad but it was quite high
bit of width, the ball jagging back in off the surface and Amla French cuts on to his pads
full length ball on the stumps, pushed back past the bowler and mid-on gets across
pitched up around the line of off, blocked into the leg side
full length delivery, Amla gets forward and nudges the ball to mid-on
back of a length, opens the face a guides the ball towards third man
overpitched outside off and Amla flicks with a flourish, a cover drive trumping a Bopara dive and the ball racing for four
slides down the leg side - that's a wide
on the stumps, drifting towards leg and Amla utilises his springloaded wrists to whip four through backward square leg, the bat facing fine leg by the end of the stroke
touch full, on off stump, pushed to mid-on on coming forward and they take one
better line and length, drawing Smith out of his crease, he shoulders arms
fullish length delivery on the stumps, worked through backward square for a single
touch short, pushed across Smith, who turns the ball straight to to midwicket
pitched up around off stump, driven back and Finn fields in his follow-through
back of a length outside the line of off, deflected towards point
dug in short at the man, Smith pulls meatily into the ground, it bounces high but Bell makes a Collingwood-esque stop at square leg to prevent a run
tip and run to mid-on, Cook picks up and scores a direct hit at the bowler's end ... but Smith was safe
full and angled across, punched back to the bowler on the front foot
dug in short this time, Smith rides it and the ball rolls towards the slips
advances aggressively, Anderson drags his length back and Smith doesn't connect properly with a swipe across the line, the ball rolling to mid-on
pitched up at the stumps, turned to the man at midwicket
full and wide of off, Smith crabs his way outside the line and drives down the ground, mid-off comes across
wide of the stumps, length ball, Amla sidles across and whips a single past midwicket
length delivery in the corridor outside off, worked to midwicket
touch wider this time, Amla opens the face of the bat and guides the ball past slip to third man
full toss, around leg stump, Smith only gets one with a shovel through square
short ball, homing in on the batsman, Amla rocks back and plays a lofted pull over midwicket - that was almost an ungainly stroke from Amla. Almost
back of a length outside off, tapped into the covers
pitched up outside off stump, too wide and Amla punches a tennis-ball drive in front of extra-cover for another boundary
strays down the leg side, flicked business-like round the corner for four to fine leg
pushed across, wide of off, blocked back down the wicket
short and pulled through deep square leg for a couple

advances and gone, bowled! Looks like Anderson rolled his fingers over the ball, again Smith's impatience got the better of him and he missed tried to pull through the on side, the ball flipping the leg bail off on its way through
back of a length, going across, squared up a touch and defended into the off side
length ball on the stumps, gets forward and blocks back to the bowler
pitched up and swinging away a touch, Amla steers the ball to third man
short of a length, pushed across the left-hander, tries to drive on the back foot and chops just past his own stumps
full and wide from Dernbach and Elgar leans into a square drive through point to get off the mark
length ball, sliding across, left alone
tight to off stump, good length, defends on the back foot to point
leaves the ball alone outside the line of off
length delivery, angling in towards middle, turned into the leg side
full and drifting towards leg stump, flicked wristily round the corner to long leg
pushed across on a fullish length, opens the face and steers one through backward point
pitched up in the channel, driven straight to mid-off
full and sliding towards leg, shuffles across and plays the ball through backward square leg from in front of the stumps
teasing delivery, leaving Elgar on a good length, stays back and fences at it uncertainly
slower ball - Dernbach's first of what I expect will be many - pushed to point on the full
full pace this time, aiming for a leg-stump yorker, Amla digs it out
slow leg-cutter, around the line of off, Amla waits on it and ticks into the leg side
full and wide of the wicket, gets forward and pushes through the covers
length ball, tailing in towards off stump, closes the face and works to midwicket
another slower ball out the back of the hand, leaves Amla off the pitch and he mistimes a dab to third man, getting a bottom edge into the turf and through to Kieswetter
fullish length delivery, on the stumps, nudged to midwicket who makes a tumbling stop
angled across on a good length, tapped to cover
full and wide, driven to deep extra-cover
continues to bowl full, outside the line of off, punched to extra-cover
pitched up and angling in towards off, can't get him away through the off side again
full and on the stumps, clips a single through square leg
tossed up on the stumps, worked back to the bowler
goes down on one knee and paddles fine on the leg side for a couple
length ball, not much spin, Amla comes forward outside the line of off and pushes down the ground
big appeal straight away, Elgar hit on the pad trying to nurdle a sweep, looked like it pitched outside the line and straightened too much anyway
flighted, around off and straightening, defended into the off side
tossed up outside off, connects with the sweep this time
length ball, angled across, blocked into the off side
full and tight to off stump, drives through cover, taking his bottom hand off the bat
pitched up and angling in, worked through midwicket with a roll of the wrists
pushed across on a fullish length, dabbed into a gap in the cover region
off cutter, tailing in and Amla inside-edges a defensive shot through his legs
pitched up outside off and languidly driven through the covers
full on middle, whipped very sweetly - it zings of his bat - but straight to midwicket
a punchy drive to a full ball outside off stump, again the timing is great but placement just a little off as he picks out the fielder
comes forward and drives to mid-off, doesn't quite time this one as the bat twists in his hand...mid-off, Cook, is in quickly and Amla has to get a scamper on
full on off stump, Elgar defends square into the off side
fuller and a touch wider this time, gives Elgar to chance to drive and he guides it through the covers
an elegant, wristy, pull from Amla as Finn drops short and the ball sits up on a gentle pitch to give him plenty of time
gone! He's got Amla. Something that England have found hard to do this summer. Was a full delivery which nipped back into Amla as he went for a drive and it takes an inside edge into leg stump
back of a length outside off, defended into the off side
again coming back into the right hander, back of a length and de Villiers defends towards the bowler
pushed down the leg side, takes a bit of bat as he glances it away and it wasn't that far from a catch to Kieswetter. On replays, Kieswetter sort of went too far. Would have been a stunning catch
played out to midwicket
short of a length, worked out to midwicket and there's almost a mix-up as they look for a single
full outside off, de Villiers comes forward with bat and pad together...chance for de Villiers to build an innings today
a little shorter, de Villiers chops it square into the off side and neither point or cover can prevent the run
good fielding at backward point by Morgan as Elgar drives firmly square into the off side
on middle and leg, gives him the chance to tuck it away backward of square on the leg side
that shoots off the middle of the bat, full on middle and off, driven firmly to mid-on
lovely shot, glorious cover drive which he played with a slightly open face to make sure he threaded the gap in the off-side field
full on off stump, Elgar likes to get onto the front foot wherever possible and then opens the face out to the sweeper on the cover boundary
comes forward to ball outside off, opens the face and guides to backward of point
beats him with a slower ball that grips a touch and takes him on the back leg but he's outside off stump
short and outside off, Elgar aims to pull it off the front foot but doesn't get much timing and gets a single wide of mid-on
angled to backward point
back of a length, punched from the back foot to cover
short of a length, worked wide of midwicket
short outside off, deflected down to third man as he plays it late
enough width to allow Elgar to open the face down to third man and for a moment he was looking for a second but Dernbach's throw was decent
dragged down short and wide but Anderson gets away with it as de Villiers cuts off the toe-end of the bat out to deep cover
tight on off stump, defended firmly into the off side
full on off stump, pushes forward with a slightly open face and finds cover
gets a leading edge from de Villiers as he tries to work to leg and the ball just straighten on him but goes quickly to ground
full on middle, defended back to the bowler
keeping it full, important at Bopara's pace, and it's driven down to mid-off
this one is wide outside off, de Villiers shapes to cut and ends up playing over the top of the ball as it doesn't bounce too much
gets one away as he drives down to the ground to long-on
opens the face square into the off side and finds the gap
round the wicket, full on middle, pushed back down the pitch
sign of pressure building? Comes down the pitch then aims to go over the leg side and gets a thick inside edge through square leg
nicely bowled, beats the outside edge with a straighter delivery as de Villiers pushes forward
neatly played, brings out the paddle reverse sweep and gets it past a diving Kieswetter and through short third-man
touch short to the left hander who can go onto the back foot and drive to the cover sweeper
goes for the pull and it isn't a million miles from midwicket but safe enough in the end
the ball continuing to shape into de Villiers, gentle pace from Bopara and it's played out to deep cover
full on middle and off, pushed down the off side and Bopara dives, getting a hand on the ball, and mid-off tidies up to prevent the run
this time he beats the bowler with a firm push and mid-off is hanging back a little
on off stump, comes forward and defends square to point
pitched even fuller, timing not easy on this surface, de Villiers punches to mid-off
tight over from Bopara as de Villiers drives on the front foot but can't beat point
manages to get a boundary but wasn't entirely convincing as he lofts Tredwell just over mid-on
that's smart batting, dabs into the off side to rotate the strike
on the back foot, whipped from off stump to square leg
that's a lovely shot, uses his feet then lofts it over midwicket without too much force in the shot and places it between long-on and deep midwicket
and again, same shot and almost the same placement but this time Bell at long-on as able to get around the boundary
full on middle, opens the face and plays it square into the off side...very good over for South Africa
driven square through the off side out to the cover sweeper
full outside off, de Villiers plays it late with an open face to third man
again he pushes towards mid-off who is too deep to cut off the single
played with a touch more flourish as he whips it with his bottom hand to long-on
shorter this time, played off the back foot by Elgar back to the bowler
fuller on middle and off, worked towards mid-on who is also unable to prevent the run...tip and run in that over
waits on the back foot against a slightly short ball and pushes to deep cover
gone! Trying to repeat the flicks over midwicket he played in the last over but this time gets the shot too straight down the ground which allows Ian Bell to steady himself under the catch
the batsmen crossed so this is Elgar and he works it away from middle and off through square leg
straighter ball outside off, takes a thick outside edge to short third man
goes for the paddle and gets it fine past the diving Kieswetter
driven back to Tredwell
keeps a tight line off stump, aims to work to the leg side but it goes straight back to the bowler
gone! Du Plessis went too far across his stumps and loses his leg stump. He went down the pitch and outside off, the ball was angling towards the leg side and du Plessis missed his flick.
neat start from Duminy as he flicks a full delivery on middle wide of mid-on with a nice piece of timing and placement
full outside off, Elgar comes forward and drives to the sweeper
defends this to backward point
comes forward outside off, gets a big stride and drives elegantly out to deep cover
round the wicket, Duminy uses his feet and works it easily down to long-on
touch quicker this time, on off stump and defended to the covers
now he goes a little slower, variation from Tredwell, and worked off the pads to deep square
big appeal for lbw...this turned and beat the edge, taking the back leg, and it probably did too much. Lovely delivery, though
comes forward and jabs into the off side
nicely bowled, tossed up on off stump and pushed to mid-off
short of a length, worked off leg stump and picks the gap between long leg and deep square
back on off stump, pushed firmly to the bowler
more tight stuff from Bopara, on off stump and Elgar can only defend to cover
stringing the dots together as Elgar plays with a straight bat to the leg side
dragged down a touch short, pulled away through midwicket but without any great timing
full outside off to Duminy, driven straight to cover as Bopara gets through another nippy over
almost picks out long-on as he tries to release the pressure by going over the top...goes once bounce to Anderson
swept away from outside off through short fine-leg
well, Kieswetter almost plucked that out have seen the attempt to paddle it away and followed the shot but couldn't quite get a leap in
chipped down the ground to long-off
dragged from a full length outside off to deep square
tossed up slow outside off, that's well played as he opens the face and picks the gap between deep cover and long-off
length ball outside off, dabbed towards point on the back foot
pitched up, full and straight, closes the face and works the ball to mid-on
very wide of the stumps this time, fired across and Duminy has to stretch his arms and toe-end the ball through backward point
full-bunger, right up in the blockhole, Elgar gets his bat down in defence

bowled him, a slow legcutter! That's a corker of a delivery from Dernbach and it's his variations that have done for Elgar! The ball came out the back of the hand, pitched on a length and came back in to hit the top of off as Elgar played around it, foxed by the lack of pace and now back in the chicken coop himself
length ball, pushed across the left-hander and left alone outside off
round the wicket, tossed up on off stump, straightening and defended on the front foot
flighted, sliding towards leg stump, skips out and clips through midwicket
floated up on off, played back to the bowler
touch short and wide of the stumps, Parnell telescopes out his arms to tap through point
full and on the stumps, worked to midwicket with a turn of the wrists
tossed up outside the line of off, gets forward to drive but can't beat the man at cover
pitched up, on the pads and Parnell sweetly times a drive wide of mid-on for four - that's the first boundary in almost nine overs
good response, back of a length and speared across, beats Parnell's prod outside off
another boundary this time, but chalk this one up to the bowler, who squares up Parnell with one that pitches on leg and leaves him, taking a thick edge to squirt through gully
another edge, this time through first slip! Good bowling from Dernbach, drawing the false stroke, but Kieswetter can't quite get there diving to his left

got him this time, edged to the keeper! Three in three for Dernbach to Parnell, the edges got progressively thinner and this one ended up comfortably in Kieswetter's bread basket. Parnell fails to make the most of his lives and England have taken the box seat in this game
length ball, angled across a touch wide and tapped on the back foot towards gully
tossed up and smartly reverse swept past short third man for a couple
comes forward and plays a length ball into the off side
tossed up on the stumps, busy in the crease and swept in orthodox fashion this time to long leg
flighted, towards leg stump, comes forward and ticks one to long-on
floated up around the line of off stump, pushed back to the bowler on the front foot
slightly wider, drifting in and then spinning, played on the back foot to point
length ball, pushed across, stays back and dabs one through backward point
full-pace yorker from Dernbach, drifts slightly wide of off stump as Peterson brings his bat down late and misses
slower ball again, outside the line of off and tempting the drive, Peterson mistimes and inside-edges past his stumps
gets this slightly wrong, full toss wide of the stumps, slapped through the covers to the sweeper
length ball, leg-stump line, Duminy doesn't connect cleanly and the ball dribbles away on the leg side
length ball angled across outside off, stays back and steers the ball to slip on the bounce
length ball outside the line of off, blocked into the off side
drags this down, short of a length, Duminy steps away and hacks a cut through cover-point
gets forward and pushes a length delivery through the covers for one
too straight from Finn, on to the pads and Duminy casually tickles it fine for four
length ball, on middle, pushed back to the bowler
full length, speared across and driven on the front foot to the cover sweeper
good length, on leg stump, goes back and turns the ball straight to square leg
pushed across Duminy on a length, hangs back and glides a single down to third man with an open bat face
more line and length from Dernbach - this is very unsettling - Peterson taps the ball through gully on the back foot
pitched up around the line of off, presses forward and drives to mid-off, they take on the arm and get one comfortably
goes back to a fullish delivery, on the stumps, manages to get bat on it and turn through square leg
slower ball to end the over and Duminy is watchful, plays late and squirts the ball to third man
full, on the stumps, possibly a slower delivery from Anderson and Duminy is this far from chipping it back into Anderson's hands
length, outside the line of off, pushed through point but they only get one, despite a misfield
beats the outside edge, Peterson hesitant in the crease poking his bat at a length ball darting across his bows
a thick outside edge playing back flies through backward point
length ball, offcutter this time, pitching on middle and rolling across, Duminy mistimes a dab and the ball bounces through to Kieswetter
full, on the stumps, pushed to mid-on coming forward
short and wide, cuts this through point in the air
fuller length, Duminy plays a slightly awkward drive-cum-cut and spoons a leading edge between cover and extra-cover
back of a length and wide of the stumps, Peterson has a swish and misses
pushed across on a length, stays a bit low and toe-ended through gully
line and length, Duminy leaves his crease and steers one to third man
touch short of a length, plenty of width and Peterson plays and misses again
good length, touch straight and worked off the legs through midwicket
tight line, length delivery, stays back and chops into the ground, fielded by point
steers another length ball through backward point to the man on the fence
length ball, pushed across into the channel, Duminy gets forward and guides another single to third man
stays on the back foot and works the ball into a gap at midwicket but they can't turn one into two
fullish length ball, pushed across outside off and driven to cover
touch shorter but quite tight to off stump which means Peterson can only cut to point
straighter this time, worked off middle through midwicket
uses his feet to try and disrupt the length but can only bunt it back to Bopara
on the pads, misses the bat and deflects to the leg side
big shout for lbw, squeezed past the bat onto the back leg but looked to have pitched outside leg quite comfortably
lovely shot, superb placement from Duminy as he cuts this late through backward point and beats third man
edged! Came down the pitch went to drive through the off side, skews off a thick edge and flies through where slip would have been

strikes this time, though. Big wicket. Duminy comes down the pitch and tries to clear the straight boundary but gets it higher rather than longer and Ian Bell settles under his second catch, this time at long-off, although it didn't go in cleanly
drifts onto leg stump, tickled away through short fine-leg
starts to come down the pitch then blocks to the leg side
quicker and flatter, Steyn back in the crease and works the ball to midwicket
touch wider outside, Steyn onto the front foot and defends square on the leg side
hint of width outside off, but's chopped into the ground and bobbles back to Kieswetter
cuts again and this time finds backward point
full on off stump, comes forward and drives but sends it straight to mid-off
finds the fielder yet again, Bopara gets away with this one which is a bit short and wide as Peterson picks out backward point
full on leg stump, tries to work it away but misses out
yes, he can. Full outside off, Peterson tries to drive but just gets a thick edge into the ground. Excellent over and a top spell from Bopara
outside off, defended to cover
worked off the stumps through the leg side to deep midwicket
round the wicket, defended solidly
on middle, Peterson tries to work to leg but is taken on the pad
now he brings how his attempt at a switch hit, the ball is full outside leg and he heaves it through the covers
a fully delivery pushed back to Tredwell and that's another tight over
dropped in short on off stump and that sits up nicely, Peterson pulls it powerfully through midwicket...bit of freebie from Anderson
full outside off, pushed firmly towards mid-off and he sets off straight away
another one goes...a good delivery from Anderson. Full on off stump, the ball holds its line, and Steyn played all around it. Jimmy will have enjoyed that.
full again, on middle and off, Morkel gets behind it and plays to the off side
keeps it full, just a hint of movement, played to the covers
starts on middle and leg, shapes away from the left hander who pushes firmly down the ground to mid-off
nice shot, in fact a terrific shot, back of a length on leg stump and he whips it over midwicket with a strong bottom-hand flick. Classy.
gets back on a full length outside off, Morkel prods forward and gets an inside edge into his boot
on middle and off, pushed firmly to cover
bit of width outside off, Morkel guides down to third man
there's the slower ball, well directed on a full length, Peterson opens the face to third man
another good slower ball, almost defeated Morkel but he just waited long enough then guide the ball wide of the keeper
tries to find third man again but only gets it as far as backward point
full outside off, driven square to the man at backward point again
cleaned up! Another for Anderson. Came into Morkel from round the wicket and scooted between bat and pad to take middle and off stump
given lbw! Tsotsobe uses the review that's left. May as well. Was trapped on the back foot. Maybe going over? He's not hit it. Just clipping the top of leg stump so that will stay on the field.

inn2.comm: length ball, on the stumps, Cook brings his bat down to chop defensively into the leg side
this slides down past leg stump, too wide for Cook, too wide for the umpire
pitched up around off, turned on the front foot to midwicket
leaves a good length ball outside off
another length delivery in the corridor, good probing line from Steyn but Cook is happy yo shoulder arms again
stays back and defends a good length ball on off into the cover region
angled across, leaving Cook a touch, no stroke
short and a touch wide, stays on the back foot and caresses a drive through square - lovely way to get off the mark
again a bit of width, back of a length, cut hard and du Plessis flings himself to the ground to stop the ball at point
edged but low, controlled by Bell, and this skids between slip and gully for four more - bit of a loose start from Tsotsobe
back of a length, stays above it and tapped into the off side
shot! Bell takes a couple of steps out of his crease, Tsotsobe drops short and is pinged over midwicket with a flowing pull shot
length delivery, pushed across from over the wicket, defended towards point
full and snaking across Cook, towards off stump, blocked into the off side
loses his line a little, on the legs and Cook tries to glance, takes the pad and runs behind square

full and straight and gone! Steyn is bang on to Bell and a review won't save him ... He was hit low on the pad, trying to play across the line and it's a good job he didn't resort to DRS because that was hitting middle and leg
pitched up outside off, pushed into the covers
tailing in towards off, good length and Trott blocks back to the bowler
length ball wide of off, opens the face and steers a single through backward point
back of a length, at the stumps, blocked back down the pitch
goes back and back cuts a good length delivery to third man
continues over the wicket to the left-hander, this tails in and takes the inside edge as Cook pushes forward, the ball looping off the pad into the leg side
back of a length, touch wide and Cook cuts into the ground towards point
defended pressing forward outside off stump
full of a length, very wide of the stumps and Cook is happy to leave
fullish length delivery, wide of off stump, steps out and pushes into the covers
pitched up, takes the pace of this a little, blocked on the front foot towards cover
short and wide this time, Trott latches on to it and cuts into the turf, du Plessis takes a couple of steps to his left at backward point and dives to make a one-handed stop
pushed across on a good length and tapped into the off side
straighter line, short of a good length, hops back and works the ball to midwicket with a solid connection
pushed through outside off, full length but this keeps low, Cook swishes and misses as the ball flies through to de Villiers
drifts on to the pads, too straight from Tsotsobe, bowling over the wicket, clipped through midwicket on Trott's favoured side
touch short, coming back in towards the stumps turned to leg
shot and outside off, tapped square on the off side
slightly short of a good length, pitching on off and continuing on to the pads, forced off the back foot through midwicket for four - Cook is off the mark from his 18th delivery
full and straight, looking for the yorker that did for Cook at West End, blocked this time
pitched up and driven on the front foot to mid-on
length ball, coming back in from outside off, stays a mite low and Trott inside-edges past his stumps for four to fine leg
stays back and plays a length ball out towards point
shuffles across and steers a short ball down to third man
round the wicket to Cook, who hangs back and clips a length ball off the pads through backward square for a couple
wide of the crease and angled in, Cook steps out and defends on the off side
length ball, wide of the stumps and clumped in front of point on the front foot for another boundary to Cook
too much width from Morkel's loosener, Trott drives on the up through cover, beats the infield and that's four
back of a length outside off, stays back and dabs one to third man
length ball, down the leg side and this brushes the pad on its way through to de Villiers - almost passed right over the top of leg stump, that
angled across the left-hander and left alone outside off
good length delivery, better from Morkel but not tight enough to the stumps to make Cook play
touch short, on the stumps, defended back down the pitch on the back foot
over the wicket, pitching on leg and pushed back down the track
angled across on a good length, steered towards point
touch short of a good length, bit of lift and beats Trott as he wafts outside off
wider this time, Trott plays with an angled bat, a slightly indeterminate dab and is beaten past the edge
tighter line and defended in front of off stump
width again, pitched up and this time Trott makes contact, steering a single to third man
short, dug in towards the batsman's body, worked through square leg with a flick of the wrists
back of a length in the corridor outside off, defended
length ball, gets forward outside off and driven at the top of the bounce to cover
leaves a length ball alone as it whistles through outside off
drifts on to the pads and Trott calmly tucks another couple through backward square leg
length ball and tapped towards point on the back foot
length ball in the channel outside off, left alone
bit of width, short and happy-slapped on the back foot through backward point
pitched up and angled across the right-hander, dug out into the off side
short of a good length, at the batsman, shovelled through midwicket to the man in the deep
defended into the leg side, playing back to a length delivery
full and ducking in, almost a leg-stump yorker but Cook whips it through backward square leg for one
length ball, sliding across outside off stump, front-foot forward defensive
bit of width, Cook hangs back and cuts with a flourish, but straight at du Plessis at point
tighter line, still back of a length and Cook gives himself some room, can't get the ball away, chopping towards cover
steers a length ball from outside off along the ground to point
short of a length, tight line but Cook is able to swing his arms, hacking to point on the bounce
and just when it appeared Cook was getting frustrated, he pulls powerfully wide of mid-on, a similar delivery to the ones he had tried to cut but this option gets four
length ball, pushed across and blocked into the covers
tight line outside off stump, Trott gets behind it and blocks towards mid-off
drags his length back, angled across and played late, steering one to third man
length ball, tight line around off stump, worked to mid-on with a closed bat face
back of a length, short-arm jab from Cook, back at the bowler who gets a hand on it and mid-off fields
full toss, tailing in towards off stump, bunted along the ground to mid-off
defended on the front foot towards cover
fuller length, comes forward and pushed to cover
edged! But it goes to ground quickly, Trott playing away from his body and the ball failing to carry to Smith at slip
short of a length but doesn't get up as much as Trott expects and he miscues his attempted pull
slower bouncer from Morkel, outside off stump, Trott hangs his bat out before changing his mind
skips out and tries to slog across the line, bottom-edging into the ground in front of the stumps ... shades of the frustration that did for Smith earlier in the day
length ball, drifting down the leg side, hits Cook on the knee roll but the appeal is pretty feeble
slightly fuller length, in the corridor, leans out and pushes to mid-off, who's right back on the edge of the circle and they take one
on the stumps, flicked through midwicket
pitched up outside off and mistimed, Cook's drive bobbling towards mid-off and they steal another single
back of a length, angled across the right-hander, patted back to the bowler from deep in the crease
pushed through on a length, steered towards point, between two fielders and they get one
hint of width but cut straight to point
onto leg stump, flicked neatly out to deep square-leg
on off stump, defended back towards the bowler
drops short, Cook pulls it away nicely backward of square but Parnell at long leg does well with a dive
full outside off, defended on the front foot to cover
back of a length this time, another one is pushed into the off side
drags his first ball down a fraction, Cook pulls straight to the man at deep midwicket
comes forward and defends to the leg side
on the back foot, angles towards leg stump and work through midwicket

gone! That's what pressure does. Another short ball from Peterson and Cooks it straight down the throat of deep midwicket. Pretty ordinary from the England captain. South Africa rewarded for tight overs
floated up on middle and leg, defended to the on side
comes forward on off stump and defends with an exaggerated stride
guide down to third man past the lone slip, goes quite find and third man has to slide...but Trott wants the second and has to get a hurry on
full outside off, Trott comes forward and plays back down the pitch
pushed outside leg stump, Trott catches up with it and flicks to deep square
back of a length on off stump, defended to the covers
beaten by a slow short ball, Bopara went to pull and was far to early on the shot...could almost have played it twice. Not very convincing.

edged, he's given! Bopara reviews it. There was a sound. He reviewed straight away. No asking. Well, no mark on Hot Spot. There is certainly a sound. This will be interesting. Is there conclusive evidence to overrule? It stays out, Bopara isn't happy but under the DRS that is the correct decision. The third umpire, Taufel, said there was a clear sound and wasn't enough evidence to overrule.
very full outside off, Trott plays over the top and misses out
comes forward on leg stump, defends back down the pitch
defended to the leg side
tossed up full, Trott drives down the ground to long-off
round the wicket to Morgan who comes forward and defends
use his crease, steps back and cuts through the off side to the sweeper
full outside off, defended solidly to the off side
back of a length, chipped in the air over midwicket but well out of reach of any fielders...actually timed it very well
back full around off stump, Morgan forces himself forward and plays to the off side
touch shorter this time and it's played from the crease with a straight bat
pushed firmly to cover...keeping the pressure on
tucked off his hip to deep midwicket so he'll keep the strike
round the wicket, Morgan uses his feet and lofts him over mid-off...had to reach for the ball a touch but had the confidence to go through the line
worked down the ground to long on
onto the front foot, opens the face and finds a gap in the off side
comes forward and defends to the off side
goes for the reverse sweep, takes it off middle stump - and all his stumps were exposes - and gets it towards short third-man
comes in the arm from Peterson, Trott pushes off the back foot towards mid-off
pitched up outside off, Morgan gets a positive stride forward and defends to cover
another nice shot, stands tall and drives off the back between point and cover...rolls over the wide square but slows towards the rope an du Plessis just flicks it back
on leg stump, flicked out to deep square
full on off stump, flicked neatly just to the left of mid-on
back outside off to the right hander, Trott meets it with a solid push to cover
a full delivery, Trott leans into a drive but doesn't time it cleanly and the ball bobbles towards mid-off where Steyn swoops and throws at the stumps but ends up in some pain on the outfield
well played by Trott, the slip area had become vacant so he reverse swept this and the short third-man couldn't stop it cleanly
flicked firmly from leg stump and square leg prevents any runs
on off stump, Trott waits then opens the face but can't beat backward point
pulled down a fraction short, gives him time to flick it off the back foot wide of mid-on
another reverse sweep, this time from Morgan, from about middle and off...again just beats short third-man who parries it away for a second
now he goes orthodox, works a straight delivery through square leg
he goes down the ground again, a full delivery which is lofted very high and not quite the distance he wanted...it plugs in the outfield towards long-off but still has the legs to dribble over
blimey, some power behind that shot as he picks up on a short ball and hammers a pull but straight to midwicket
starts to use his feet, Tsotsobe pitches a touch shorter and it's worked to midwicket
now he's offered some width and slices a cut shot behind square...it went in the air, but split the gap and went very quickly
similar delivery, perhaps a fraction straighter, and Morgan defends to cover
comes at the bowler again but then opts to defend to cover...good over for England
on off stump, hint of turn, defended to the off side
full on middle and leg, defended to the leg side
another reverse sweep from Trott, the ball was outside off stump, but it goes straight to short third-man
neatly worked off the back foot through midwicket, a trademark stroke from Trott
some slow turn from an off-stump line, the ball doesn't quite bounce as Trott squats in defence on the back foot
now he comes well forward and flicks a straight delivery through midwicket
lovely stroke from Trott, leans into an off-drive against a full delivery, and Steyn fumbles another save at mid-off although got bit of a rough bounce
pushed wide outside off, Trott shapes to cut but doesn't make contact and the umpire extends his arms
shuffles outside off stump and pushes this towards mid-off, Steyn again, who is quite deep
neatly played, hint of shape into Morgan who tucks it off his pads down to long leg where Morkel can't prevent the second as he fails to pick up cleanly
pushed down the leg side and that's another extra
ah, more elegance from Morgan, he just leans on a half-volley on off stump and slots it between a diving cover and mid-off...lovely stroke
drives with an open face as he tries to place it through square cover but finds backward point
full on off stump, sweetly timed to mid-off...another useful over for England
nicely bowled from the round the wicket, tossed up and comes off a thick outside edge to short third man, but well controlled by Trott
works with the angle coming into him and punches wide of mid-on
flicks it in the air from outside off but falls short of midwicket
there's that reverse sweep/paddle/swipe again, but it isn't timed cleanly and goes square on the off side
onto the front foot and driven to cover
fired in fuller and Trott's feet and he works down to mid-on
round the wicket, very full outside off, driven to cover
flicked straight to midwicket
outside leg stump, flicked straight to short fine-leg
down the pitch and ends up yorking himself and it runs into the off side
fired down the leg side
nicely placed, driven with an open face through the off side and places it wide of the cover sweeper
quicker ball to finish with, defended to the off side
starts full at off stump, Morgan drives and gets a thick inside edge that rebounds off his boot to the off side
shows intent to come at the bowler, then works a length ball towards midwicket who can't quite stop it with a dive
full and wide of stump, Trott plays a neat-looking cover drive that runs out to the sweeper on the fence
back of a length on off stump, flicked out to midwicket
close! A slower ball, Morgan plays a fraction early and it lobs just of Morkel running in from mid-off
gets a yorker in, dug out to the on side
full on off stump and eased down to long-off
comes down the pitch, makes it a low full toss, and bunts it back past the bowler to long-on
ooh, big turn there, although quite slow, as it spins past the outside edge
more slow turn, pitches very short, Trott works it off the back foot to mid-on
another short one and again Trott misses out as he cuts to cover...hard to time on a slow surface
comes forward and plays to cover...tight over
outside off, chopped to backward point
plays and misses at a cut shot...ball was there to put away
low full toss that he can't get away as he drills it to mid-on
comes forward, defends and gets an inside edge
picks out another fielder, this time slicing away a wide delivery outside off straight to backward point
short ball, goes for the pull but splices it towards mid-on...a maiden from Parnell
tossed up and turned through the leg side from in front of the wicket
slow, looping offbreak, Morgan tries to reverse sweep but is too quickly through the shot, hitting the toe of the bat and the ball spinning thorough to the keeper down the leg side
ho ho, there we go! Morgan steps out to smash a full toss over deep midwicket, that's a huge six, connected with a sound like a rifle shot
charges down the track again but blocks towards midwicket
flighted across on a length, goes back and cuts through point
gives this a rip, straightening on the stumps, Trott gets a leading edge trying to play to leg but it falls short of the man at cover
length ball in the channel outside off, steered down to third man
full and straight, punched towards cover from in front of cover
but that won't help the cause, on the pads and glances round the corner but the fleet-footed Morgan for four to fine leg
length ball, outside off, hops back and slashes hard through backward point to the man on the fence
bouncer, at the man, Trott nods howdy do as it sails through
touch short, in the channel outside off, hangs back and guides a single to third man - it feels like he's been playing that shot all day, and that is Trott's  fifty
length ball on the stumps, played into the off side on the back foot
pitched up on middle and leg, Trott works this through midwicket, past the diving fielder for three into the wide open spaces of the The Oval outfield
eh up, Morgan has almost caught Trott, moving to a half-century of his own with a flick to deep backward square leg
angled across on a good length, deflected down to third man with an open face of the bat
overpitched on off stump, Morgan is quick to come forward and punch down the ground to long-on
length delivery, speared across, steered to point on the back foot
full and wide and DISPATCHED over extra-cover, Morgan leans out and creams a lofted drive over the infield for four
back of a length, on the body and defended back down the wicket
slanted across on a full length, pushed through the covers
Trott goes back and across to a delivery wide of the stumps and chops to third man
down the leg side, Morgan flicks and misses ... but it's called wide anyway
Morgan goes back and crouches to back cut a length ball through the gully region for a single into the deep
pitched up on off stump, gets forward and taps back to the bowler
full length, wide of the off stump, steps out and punches to cover on the half-volley
leg-stump full toss, Morgan scoops across the line out to deep backward square leg, where Hashim Amla sprawls to good effect in front of the boundary rope to prevent four
phenomenal shot from Morgan, skipping out to loft a cover drive way back over wide long-off for an imperious six!
attacks again, hoicking over the infield out to deep midwicket for a single
goes round the wicket now, angled in on a length, tucked to midwicket
full and straight, pushed defensively back past the bowler and they steal one to mid-on
pitched up outside the line of off, pushed back down the track
length ball, in the corridor outside off, gets across and taps into the covers
full and angling in towards off, Trott tries to play to leg and gets an inside edge on to his front pad
short and a touch wide, Trott is able to delicately dab fine of third man and they get back for a second
full length and drifting towards leg stump, leans out and clips through square leg
overpitched outside off stump and Morgan flays this in calculated fashion low past mid-off for another boundary
flat delivery on middle and leg, goes back and turns through midwicket
pushed across, bit of dip outside off, Morgan goes back and mistimes a cut to backward point
tossed up on the stumps, driven on the back foot to long-on
angled across on a length, Morgan is busy in the crease, presses forward then goes back to chop one into the gap between short third man and deep backward point

slog-sweeps across the line and skied high into the air, Peterson steadies himself underneath it to complete the catch! Though he then let the ball slip out of his hand as he went to throw it back into the air in celebration, causing Morgan to linger ... but after a brief consultation between the umpires, he is rightly told to be on his way
floated up on off stump, grips and straightens, solid forward defensive
length ball outside off stump, Trott cuts to backward point on the edge of the circle
full and in the channel, Trott steps out and drives to the cover sweeper
pitched up outside the line of off, Kieswetter gets forward and shows it the full face of the bat
angled in toward middle and leg, hits Kieswetter on the pad and then bobbles off the glove short on the leg side
length ball on the stumps, turned into a gap at midwicket
steps out and plays a length ball back to the bowler ... and Morkel throws at the stumps, as Trott steps away
tossed up and played back to the bowler
gives this a bit of air outside off, Kieswetter opens the shoulders and drives through the covers for a couple
clips this back in the air just short of the bowler
tossed up on off, driven back to the bowler

flighted on middle and leg, thumps into the front pad as Kieswetter presses forward and Peterson asks for a review of the not-out decision ... but it wasn't turning enough and would have slid past leg stump
floated up on the stumps and Kieswetter exacts maximum pain for Peterson after that failed review but thumping six over wide long-on with a mighty swing of the blade
driven back to the bowler
touch short, whipped through midwicket
pitched very full, on the popping crease, driven square through the off side and that's swift running
presses forward and steers the ball square into the off side
very full at the stumps, Trott reverse sweeps straight to short third-man and it was quite a tight single....in fact, Trott would have short at the non-striker's end with a hit.
comes forward again and steers square of the wicket...steady over of ticking over
on off stump, hint of turn, defended to point
on leg stump, swept very firmly but square leg makes a good stop
dropped, a big full toss is drilled straight back to Peterson and it just burst through his hands...the bowler makes out he didn't pick it up
comes forward and defends carefully
driven inside-out forcefully to extra cover where du Plessis can't stop it cleanly...that's rare
that's some poor cricket from England...Trott worked a full ball to mid-on and the throw to de Villiers is good enough to catch Kieswetter well short despite a dive
full outside off, driven from the front foot to cover
elegant flick from Trott, back of a length and he works it wide of mid-on
chops down on this ball quite late and it goes to slip
low full on middle and off, played into the pitch and it bounces over Parnell to mid-on
outside off, pushed square to point
dragged down short, Trott is quickly onto a pull but picks out midwicket
full on middle and off, pushed back to the bowler
opens the face into the off side and Patel is off the mark
driven out to cover
flicked between midwicket and mid-on to the man in the deep
dragged down very short, it spins quite a bit which means Patel can only get the bottom of the bat on his pull
leans forward and pushes to cover...that ends Peterson's ten overs, been another decent showing from him
beaten! Round the wicket and it zips off the surface past the outside edge...but Parnell has overstepped
well, think Patel forgot it was a free hit. He just prodded a full ball to cover and then would have been run out to boot with a direct hit
on the stumps, defended to midwicket
offers up some width outside off, drives but straight to mid-off
tries to get this past backward point but can't beat the fielder
very full outside off and this time he gets it down to third man with a late deflection
a full delivery on the stumps is nicely timed with a flick to mid-on...this is not ending in a flourish
bit of a flourish from Trott as he comes across the crease and whips this from outside off through midwicket...a mini flamingo maybe?
he's creamed that, gave himself room outside leg and drilled his drive but straight to cover
wide outside off, Trott goes for a cut and doesn't connect...costs an extra ball and run, de Villiers not entirely impressed
very full on middle, Trott plays across the line and works it wide of mid-on
nicely bowled, full on off stump, hint of movement into Patel who defends
there's some aggression, picks up a length ball over mid-on and it goes two bounces to the boundary...strong shot
full outside off, pushed square into the off side where backward point parries it
full outside off, driven with a bit of sparkle by Patel but straight to mid-off...been a lot of hitting fielders today
short ball, goes for the pull and takes the top of the pad through to de Villiers
very full, forced square of the wicket to point
drives and gets a thick edge into his pads which runs into the off side
he won't see England home. Feels for a ball outside off going across him and gets a thin edge to de Villiers.
outside off and left alone...scoots fairly close to off stump. That ends an excellent 10 overs from Parnell.
driven on the up, was wide outside off and it went in the air for a while past a diving cover but well out of reach of the fielder
drives again and this time comes off a thick inner part of the bat to midwicket
played off the back foot and gets a controlled outside edge to third man
speared in full at leg stump, dug out to the leg side
flicked away off leg stump down to long leg so the scores are level
it's all over...drives a full ball over cover, not quite out of the middle but it gets the single they needed
